title: Foundation: O/L and Technical Drawing Skills
description: After G.C.E. O/L, focus on developing technical drawing skills. Taking Technology stream subjects for A/L, specifically Technical Drawing, is highly advantageous. A keen eye for detail and spatial awareness is crucial.

title: Vocational Training and CAD Software
description: Enroll in a Draughtsmanship course at a vocational training institute. The primary focus of this stage is to master Computer-Aided Design (CAD) software, especially AutoCAD, which is the industry standard.
qualifications: National Vocational Qualification (NVQ) Level 4/5 in Draughtsmanship

title: Junior Draughtsman
description: Work in an architectural, engineering, or construction firm under the supervision of architects, engineers, or senior draughtsmen. You will be responsible for creating, editing, and managing technical drawings based on sketches and specifications.

title: Senior Draughtsman / BIM Modeler
description: Advance to a senior role where you handle more complex drawings and may coordinate the work of junior staff. At this stage, learning Building Information Modeling (BIM) software like Revit is crucial for career progression, transitioning you into a BIM Modeler role.
institutes: Leading construction and design firms adopting BIM technology

title: Chief Draughtsman / Design Coordinator
description: In a leadership role, you will manage the entire drawing office or design team. You'll be responsible for ensuring the quality and consistency of all technical drawings, coordinating with different engineering disciplines, and managing project deadlines.
qualifications: Extensive experience and expertise in CAD and BIM
